thread.title: Visiting Lamar rolls past Mansfield by 30
thread.title_full: Visiting Lamar rolls past Mansfield by 30

author: Travis Simpson (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Visiting Lamar rolls past Mansfield by 30
text: slideshow MANSFIELD — The Lamar Warriors rocketed past the Mansfield Tigers 50-20 on Friday.Dusty Wilkins opened the scoring after scooping up a fumbled punt for a 28-yard touchdown. Blake Kern hit the PAT kick to make it 7-0 with 10:04 left in the first quarter.Hunter Davenport struck next with a 60-yard pass to Austin Hency. Kern added the PAT to make it 14-0 with 5:50 left in the first quarter.Wilkins made it 21-0 with 1:10 left in the first quarter on a 10-yard run.Davenport scored again, this time on a 15-yard pass to Kern with 10:44 left in the second quarter to make it 28-0 after the PAT by KernWilkins scored on a 2-yard carry with 8:04 left in the half. Kern’s PAT made it 35-0 — enough already for the Mercy Rule.Brannon Gilbert scored on a 4-yard run to make it 42-0 at halftime.Joe Mueller finished the Lamar scoring on a 63-yard run with 7:17 left in the third. Austin Ware ran in the 2-point conversion to make it 50-0.Mansfield scored three touchdowns as time dwindled.Davenport finished the night 4-of-4 for 122 yards and two touchdowns. Wilkins had 121 yards on eight carries and two touchdowns. Kern had three catches for 67 yards and a touchdown. Hency had a 60-yard touchdown.Defensively, Davenport had eight tackles and three tackles for loss. Darwin Harris, Mueller, Isaac Felkins and Dylan Lovell each had five tackles.The Warriors will travel to Booneville on Friday.
